title: Trio Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: super kind, patient and organized process. i enjoyed the process! it done via zoom due to covid pandemic i preferred this interview option! It was three individuals and then myself
Interview Questions: super kind, patient and organized process.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: it was an online interview, the PI asked some questions about the Research Project and my personal background. They also asked how I can contribute to the project they are doing.
Interview Questions: 1: what projects have you done? 2: What do you think of the project we are doing, and do you have any suggestions that can enrich the project?

title: Facility Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process had multiple rounds and was thorough. Group and individual style. First round you interview and work with others while being monitored by interviewers, second round is a one on one with a few people on the panel.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and easy. I only had to do one interview and the interviewers were very nice and outgoing. I heard back from the interview fairly quickly.
Interview Questions: How do your career goals align with the role of this internship?

title: Football Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great process, and simple questions. So long as your competent and have somewhat of resume you should get the positions. It’s not as high demand as some would think. But the process was easy and concise the whole way through. Sometimes there was some miscommunication through out the process.
Interview Questions: What would you like to do

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good. It was a quick online process over zoom during the summer and I was interviewed by three different people, who are now my supervisors. It was around 30 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Typical questions any job would ask

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Process was very thorough and thoughtful, although I think this depends very much on what department or office is hiring. Overall UGA does a good job of job descriptions, onboarding and training, but again I think this depends on the department or office.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an advisor?

title: Building Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Intense in front of panel with five to six people all asking questions one after another back and forth that lasted 45 minutes with difficult questions pertaining to different situations
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for uga

title: Reporter/Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to several people working at the station and was shown around the office. They asked me what I'd like to cover in journalism and decided based on my interests what kinds of stories I'd be assigned.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of working in Public Radio Broadcasting? (I was hired as an intern while in college, so this question made sense).

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with 4 other people. They asked general icebreaker questions and then how I would answer questions that students or parents might ask during a tour.
Interview Questions: How would you describe the party scene in Athens?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview with the university center for the adjunct profession. The interview went well, they asked many questions regarding qualifications and preferences in scheduling. It was a good process to learn more about the university and its organizational needs.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about this position

title: Call Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Easy, laid back. I was asked about why I chose my major, how I liked college so far, and a subject I was passionate about. The questions were targeted so that they understood my personality and speaking style.
Interview Questions: What's your major? How do you like college so far? What year are you?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and short, but the University takes FOREVER to do anything so you'll be waiting a while to hear back after your interviews. The process can last for months.
Interview Questions: How good are you at multitasking?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I have only had one interview with them but they have invited me for the second round. The interviewers were very sweet and friendly and made me feel very comfortable.
Interview Questions:
1. Introduce yourself.
2. How long are you willing to work for us?
3. Can you work full time?
4. What do you like to do?
5. Why have you not applied to grad school?
6. Some questions to judge if I can be a team player.

title: Lifeguard Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't bad, had to go over basic chemicals and shadow for a week and do the lifeguard test. Pretty east job, pay was okay though. Overall I enjoyed it, co-workers made the job more fun.
Interview Questions: Q: I honestly don't remember, but they did ask you to preform chemicals and an in person interview.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: One interview with 3 people. Asked questions about major and prior experience. Not super intense but each person asked different questions some technical and some general. Lasted about 30-45minutes and there was room for me to ask questions. They also explained the different areas and we talked about which internship track would best suit my goals.
Interview Questions: I see on your resume you were ____ tell me more about this experience

title: Administrative Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The preliminary interview was conducted through zoom, but if I’m granted a second interview, that will be given in person. I was contacted by one member of a three-person panel to schedule it, and the interviewers took turns asking questions. Each person asked 3-4 questions. At the end, I was given the opportunity to ask questions as well. The entire process lasted about 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work in this position?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Typical. I was in need of financial assistance. And showed myself as to nice affordable option for the employer.  I was asked about partnering skills and the sort. This requirement for 30 words is frustrating. I just want to see how much the organization I'm interested in offers it's employees.
Interview Questions: If I could meet the requirements

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Interview of lecturer position in structural engineering. Two search committee participated in the online interview and introduce their research background. The whole process takes around 30 minutes and 10 questions about teaching/ industrial working experience were asked during the interview.
Interview Questions:
1. Introduce yourself and your teaching experience.
2. Do you have any questions for us?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Applied via email and set up informal meeting in person at a scientific conference. Talked for 5 minutes on expectations as a graduate research assistant and a brief description of the research projects.
Interview Questions: Willing to do field work

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: was super laid back and easy. hired on the spot! Interviewer was kind and was willing to work with student schedules. Not many questions regarding skill but more on availability.
Interview Questions: What would you consider a strength?

title: House Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: First was an introduction and application at the student job fair, followed by a single in person panel with manager and a peer in the role.  Approximately 45 minute interview.
Interview Questions: Basic overview of experience and behavioral interview. This was a student position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions:
It was two rounds of online interview. Overall great experience. 
It was two rounds of online interview. Overall great experience. 
It was two rounds of online interview. Overall great experience.
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out than other candidates?

title: Information Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, I went up the stairs and met three people in a conference room. One of them was the student manager, the manager, and a student worker. They gave me a few categories of questions. They wanted to understand my customer service experience, my understanding of technology, and they wanted to gauge my communication skills. They ended with a funny question and gave me a chance to ask questions. I asked many questions.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between Thunderbolt and USB

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I arrived and went through a 30 minute interview. it was some background questions and some questions about how i would respond to situations. There were also questions about my experience in similar postions.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple straightforward 30 minute interview with a look at my portfolio. Spent time talking about the position, its requirements, hourly work requirements, and expectations for work. We otured the facilities and met some of the other employees in the office.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to work at UGA Libraries?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions:
The first step was phone-interview for screening and then I was invited to the campus for an interview. 
It was a typical 2 days on-site interview in which you have many 30 minutes 1-to-1 meetings with potential co-workers. There was also a meeting with students.
Interview Questions: What is your research and teaching philosophy?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. Not much prep is needed for it. The questions are what you would expect. However, it took a few weeks before I heard back from them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over zoom with an in-person option. The interviewer began with a personal introduction and an overview of the SSAC, followed by a breakdown of the position. Next, they asked a few questions about previous work experience and communication skills. Lastly, there was time for me to ask questions about the role and department.
Interview Questions: What was a problem you've faced during work or a project and how did you go about solving it?

title: Public Relations Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I did a round with the hiring committee (6 people) and then an interview with the dean. The interview was very thorough and it was clearly they expected a lot from this position, but also didn't know what they wanted. Some of the questions were nonsensical (people who didn't understand what they were asking.) The job is still open 6 months later.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview. Pretty calm, had two of the lead Epidemiologists ask me questions about my interview experience and data analysis experience. Preceded the interview questions with talking about the research project and what I would be doing. Asked me questions about time management and communication styles.
Interview Questions:
Describe some of your interview experience with X organization. 

How adept are you at handling special topics and taboo topic such as sexual violence?

title: Front Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy to have and the managers were open to a variety of skills. Hiring depend more on your openness to learning. Each office has different procedures and being able to respond is key. Having prior customer service experience was also helpful during the interview.
Interview Questions: If you are unable to answer a question or respond to a situation what do you do?

title: Art Clerical Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: A simple low stake talk with management. They barely looked at my resume, and since I had already worked as a student and they needed the position filled, they gave me the job easily.
Interview Questions: If I had any experience in the arts

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I applied through Handshake and the process was very straightforward . The interview was a single round behavioral question.  It was an average interview process and it was super easy. They explained the details of the job very well so I understood what  to expect.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weakness?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I applied via Handshake. The process was very easy to do. The interview was a single round of behavioral interviews. I met with the manager of the solutions center in the terry college of business.
Interview Questions: No questions were really unexpected

title: Security Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: The interview was rather easy. All behavioral questions, nothing technical because it's all about taking care of your patrons and normal things. I'd say the only problem is getting the interview since so many students desire the job.
Interview Questions: Name a situation when you went out of your way to do something?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward interview. The hiring manager will be very interested in you if you were selected for an interview. Be vibrant and honest about available hours to work. It will only help you, not hurt you.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: A group of four interviewers.  Each asked two questions. It was more like a conversation instead of question and answers. Really got to know each other. I think it was an average interview process. It wasn't difficult but it wasn't super easy. They explained the details of the job very well so  I would understand completely what I would be doing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked with a difficult coworker?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Valdosta, GA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Phone  interview to check my experience
Video  interview to see if I qualified for the position 
That was all. I didn’t get further interviews 
I’m still hoping to get further interviews
Interview Questions: My experience in an adjunct position

title: Lab Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process. Dress professionally and come with experience. They generally look for younger students who have 1.5+ years left of school with experience in tools and equipment. Would highly recommend getting acquainted with the Fabrication Lab and standard CNC machines.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with machines and troubleshooting?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Interview was for the atlanta location -Executive Education. Interview was very condescending and rushed. They expected quick answers and I was repeatedly told to hurry.  I didn’t even get an email telling me that I was not selected for another interview or a “we regret to inform you”. Just goes to show how UGA does business. I would not want to work in that type of environment. Not to mention pay is low and hours are expected to be long. Wouldn’t recommend working for  UGA to anyone.
Interview Questions: More than 10 questions that were very repetitive and scripted. Was not a conversation like it should be just question, answer, next.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Filled the application. A couple of days later, received an email. Came into the office for the interview the following week. Interviewed by two individuals. Was asked behavioral questions. Welcoming environment at the office.
Interview Questions: Are you a self-starter?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions:
It was mainly behavioral questions, e.g. what's your accomplishments? Previous projects? How did you solve conflicts? 
They also asked some research experiences and details about projects. 
One round interview process
Interview Questions: What's your accomplishments?

title: Research Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It was an introductory interview so very simple. The interview process was a few day after I applied for the position and ment for work study students therefore there was not much to be nervous about. The researcher made me feel at ease by asking question that were relevant to me and then I was able to come to the lab and gain some insight on the lab. The interview experience worth while because I go the job and the researcher was very friendly and even the working experience was great.
Interview Questions: How many hour will you commit per week?

title: Public Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the UGA HR website. I was contacted via email 2 weeks after submitting requesting a phone interview. I interviewed with the communications team over the phone. Very basic questions about writing experience, working with a team, etc. I was contacted 4 days later and asked to come in for an in-person interview, which was broken into several parts: meeting with the senior communications director, meeting with the communications team, and meeting with the Dean of the college. All were very friendly and there were no curve ball questions. In-person interview lasted 2+ hours. I was hired the day after.
Interview Questions: How are you working with a team?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple interview process. One interview of  basic questions about laboratory safety. I was asked about my experience and about my work ethic.  I was offered the job the same day as my interview
Interview Questions: Q: Have you ever worked in a lab before?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied early in Spring Semester and got an email back during the summer to interview for Fall Semester.  Interviewed in early August.  Very casual discussion.  Got offer on the spot.  Position is more about if your school schedule fits their needs than your specific skills/experiences.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work experience

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, asked about class schedule, how many hours I wanted to work, and some basic interview questions like tell me about yourself, why do you want to work here, etc.
Interview Questions: What is your class schedule?

title: EITS Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Met with the two managers, they asked very standard questions (What are your strengths and weaknesses? What will you bring to the team?) and it was over in about 20-30 minutes. Was offered the job soon afterward.
Interview Questions: What will you bring to the team?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: They asked me some basic statistic problems. And they also wanted to know whether I would like to stay in academia after graduation. The interviewers were very nice. They did not want you to know everything, just so see if your are a good person with potential.
Interview Questions: Definition of conditional probability

title: International Education Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Interviewees were required to create a presentation to be delivered to office personnel. It was not clear who all I would be presenting to; I had anticipated presenting to a few individuals in upper management, but found out when I arrived that I would be presenting to a large portion of the office (15-20 people). I found the Q&A to be helpful and a good opportunity for me to elaborate on my presentation and my goals for my role, if offered the position. While I found it helpful to meet a number of staff members, the interview half-day felt rushed, as if it had been planned relatively last-minute.
Interview Questions: Which methods of recruitment do you believe would prove most effective in reaching students and promoting our study abroad programs here at UGA?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a formality. Met with head of department and few others, but by that point the job was practically already offered to me. They were very nice, I recommend
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions:
It's really easy to get if your advisor supports you and department budget allows.
The class assigned to you may not be the most fitting, but I had the freedom to choose which class I wanted to teach the next semester
Interview Questions: which semester do I prefer to teach

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Online application and then in-person interview. The process was relatively easy. Would suggest that you understand the core principles of UGA Housing. Explain why you'd be a good fit for the role and how you can provide value as an RA.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you handled conflict.

title: Fire Extinguisher Inspector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy, mainly asking about how much work you can handle and basic interview questions. Make sure you can handle the workload during busy months (spring break, summer, christmas break, thanksgiving, etc.)
Interview Questions: Does your course load enable to you work each week?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very Simple. The task from day to day varied. I personally enjoyed working at the university. The schedule is very flexible for students too. Also, university jobs are not usually labor intensive.
Interview Questions: What are some of your interest?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview and 1 on-site interview with the major professor and other graduate students in the lab I was applying for. It was a full day interview. I had a brief campus tour, lab tour, and a lunch with my major professor.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this program and lab?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: applied online, got brought in for an interview as an outgoing freshman/incoming sophomore in college. I was looking for something not in the food industry to work in because I had worked in the office environment in high school and felt like I was qualified.
Interview Questions: If I had experience with confidential info

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Typical behavioral questions and why you would be a good fit for the role and company. They try to get to know more about you and roles you may be interested in.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: EITS Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interview, not very technical. Interview questions were on UGA career center website, and it was more about what to do as a consultant than about me and my resume. Very easy process, met with 2 IT managers in EITS and took 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an upset customer?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I simply spoke to my TA about how I could get involved, and she referred me to the professor. I sent an email at the end of the semester in which I took the class, and I got an email from her with the offer later that summer!
Interview Questions: What was your grade in the course?

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
3 person interview 

asking tech questions not related to the job.

2 people from other teams that I never saw.

Manager was not the brightest light bulb.

Stay away from UGA unless you like to pay for parking.
Interview Questions: what is your background in IT

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Washington, DC) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Skype Chat about who I was, why I wanted to work there and some situational Questions.
Not sure what else I am supposed to add, it was an easy process
Skype is awkward to use but I was not in the state when the process occurred so it was the only option
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Environmental Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very throughout. The interviewer explained the job responsibilities and work environment in great detail. She had a great attitude and quickly made me feel at ease.  She asked real-life questions instead of scenarios which made the whole process easier and more efficient.
Interview Questions: My experience working with children

title: Athletic Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with three or four people individually for one-on-one interviews in their offices, then had an interview in front of a panel of full-time support staff members over lunch. Afterwards, I had another one-on-one interview with the director of the program.
Interview Questions: What are some things you would change about the way the program is currently run?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: No interview and Immediate employment. Not always the most enjoyable experience due to the nature of  high volume kitchens. would likely not take the position again. However, if there was no other choice it is far from the worst.  Would recommend for students.
Interview Questions: when are you available?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 Rounds of the interview process. 1. Paper rounds 2. Interview 3. Employer selection within the leadership team. After that, you will be located in a respective residence hall depending on which employer of the building selects you.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with 4 women, all heads of different areas within the department.  The interview was only an hour, each one asked questions and took notes.  Very relaxed, friendly.
Interview Questions: Typical questions - how do you handle conflict with a co-worker, client, etc.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to visit the campus, partake in a series of one-on-one interviews with individual department faculty, and meet current graduate students in the program. The process was just as much me interviewing the faculty as them interviewing me. I was able to drive myself to the campus, so I am not sure if transportation would have been covered otherwise. However, I was able to stay with a current graduate student, and was treated to food and a social hour where interviewees could mingle in downtown Athens with the graduate students who would become their peers if they accepted UGA's offer.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this program? (Why UGA?)

title: Graduate Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was flown out for an interview. The process lasted about three days. It was less of an interview and more just showing me life at UGA. It was not intimidating.
Interview Questions: Why do you want a PhD

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a number of faculty members. Each interview lasted for 15 mins. Most of the interviews were casual. You just need to be relaxed to chat with faculties and to get know about what they are doing.
Interview Questions:
Q: What is the biggest challenge you encounter during your Master's study?
Q: What is your future goal?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Brief one-on-one with the tutor coordinator asking about previous work history and how those experiences made me qualified as a first-time tutor. The coordinator was very friendly and I was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Do you know the different types of learning styles?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process, first phone screening with HR followed by technical phone screen with hiring manager/professor. On-site interview involved research presentation on your previous research and discussion(Q & A) session.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience handling graduate students?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Take a test that shows you can work in a pharmacy. It was face to face, and after the test you were graded and given a tour of the pharmacy and hospital.
Interview Questions: How to compound something into a suspension.

title: Dining Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty easy interview, I am a student though so UGA tends to be easier on its students. I  just applied and they were short on people so on the day of the :interview" i was pretty much brought in for training
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Did not apply, was contacted directly by the hiring department. SOmeone within my graduate department referred me for the position and the hiring manager contacted me directly to complete an interview.
Interview Questions: Do you find you work better in a team or individual setting?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on handshake, received email for interview about a month later. Scheduled an interview for the next day. Interview was relaxed. Spent most of the time talking about what the job would be and then touring the building where I would work.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with problem customers in the past?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Responded quickly to application and set up interview within days. Interview took 30 minutes with questions about past achievement and future goals. Follow-up about final decision was in less than a week. Overall professional and quick process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: An interview where I had to learn how to find parking, got lost finding the correct building (someone was glad to help), and then met with the director and two other managers. Two of the three interviewing were very pleasant, but one was asking riddles. Any job that asks riddles in the interview is trying to see if you can decipher what management is saying. So I was worried, but answered questions, went over job responsibilities, work life, and pay. I left with a pleasant feeling and was excited to find out if I got the job or not. I did have to wait for a call and approval of a background check.
Interview Questions: Can you solve these SQL queries as to what is missing for these tables?

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Handshake and received an email asking for my availability for the interview. I sat down in front of the three supervisors, and they went through my resume and asked about previous positions I had held.
Interview Questions: What color skittle would you be?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
You have to stalk the iPaws page once a day, because sometimes jobs are only posted for 1 day. They make it easy by having your resume on file so that you can spam your resume to all the positions you fit. 

After months of applying to various jobs with no contact back, I applied to my current position and was called soon after. I got called less than a week later and was offered an interview. Which I took. The whole interview was about an hour and was a very pleasant experience. I met with the business manager, the department head, and my two coworkers so that they could ask me their own questions (mileage may vary, we just have a small department). The campus is massive and it's easy to get lost, so I arrived way too early and sat nearby with a coffee and waited. 

The questions were all about my previous experience and going more into detail about that. Pretty generic.
Interview Questions: How good are you at multitasking?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. I wasn't asked anything unexpected. It lasted about an hour in front of a small panel. The interviewers were friendly and kind. The hardest part was dealing with all the construction on campus.
Interview Questions: What do you do to relax?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I had applied online. I didnt really get an interview myself before i got the offer. I already had a Masters and publications. But my peers described the interview process as very cordial and professional
Interview Questions: No questions

title: Clinical Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: They look my background and education to see if I got the experience in the job.  And ask me research related question and see how I will look at the question
Interview Questions: Do you know some data or statistical programing ?

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Concise, friendly, inquiries based on resume. Was taken to a 1:1 office setting and spoken to by potential supervisor. Low stress and easy questions. Dress specified to be casual because of interview location being within the animal care facility.
Interview Questions: What is your opinion on animal research?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
In the following order there was 
1. A submission of resume
2. small questionnaire
3. in-person interview with upper level staff
4. skills testing
After those four steps were completed I was hired, it was an overall quick and painless experience
Interview Questions: What culture of work environment are you looking for?

title: Promotions Assist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very short and semi-formal just trying to understand why I wanted to be a part of the Athletic Association team at UGA. Only took a few minutes just to go over responsibilities and what is expected of you during the week in the office and at games.
Interview Questions: Why are you here?

title: Guest Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interviewers, clear expectations, casual but professional, quick and painless. It was more like a conversation than an interview -- basically just wanting to know how you are with customer service because that it literally the job
Interview Questions: How are you with task management?

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the supervisor who asked me to come in for an interview in the following week.  Came in and was interviewed by 4 people (HR, 2 Helpdesk and 1 IT security), interview was very relaxed and I enjoyed every minute !
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: good interview process. very much on point and would recommend to all. should reach limit so writing something still not full again writing something which has nothing to do with this interview process. Still not 30.
Interview Questions: tell me a about yourself?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
very short , a phone call then in person interview. I was asked about behavioural questions 
very relaxed atmosphere and staff was very nice. 
very common interview questions like how you would handle situations and etc
Interview Questions: how do u handle criticism

title: Fire Safety Inpsector Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 hr interview describing myself, personality, work-ethic. Pretty basic questions, mainly confirming if I can get along with the group and can get the work done. I was referred to the position which may have made the interview easier.
Interview Questions: How much time can you commit a week to this position?

title: IT Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Not too formal. Easy IT questions related to what IT experience I have. Don't need to be IT trained but do need some knowledge in the field to qualify and actually get stuff done.
Interview Questions: How do you troubleshoot... this this and that

title: Information Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was one round, the interviewer was mainly interested in how long I had left in school, what my availability was, and how well I interacted with people/provided customer service.
Interview Questions: If I had consistent availability and if so what it was?

title: Rec Sports Field Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward. After applying online, I received a phone call from the department director and had a short informal phone screen. At the end of the phone call, I was asked to come in for an interview. The interview consisted of a panel of two senior supervisors and the department head. After a series of behavioral questions and asking me why I'd fit in, they asked some goofy questions just to have a little bit of fun. Overall, the interview was pretty relaxed and nothing too high stress.
Interview Questions: How would I deal with a noncompliant patron that gets angry?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Online application, brief phone interview, then quick in-person interview with the department head.  I was primarily asked about my experience and my vision for the department. There weren't any behavioral or situational questions.  It was just a conversation about where I've been and where I would like to go.  The job was then described in further detail, and I got to see the office space where I would be working.
Interview Questions: What is your dream job?

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It wasnt too hard, only 4 questions and they were fairly straight forward. It was nothing to be nervous about,  be sure to mention previous work experience.  Also remember to dress nicely
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: interviewed by professors, they are smart. We were talking a lot about their research fields. And I was talking some my background and other stuffs, from study to living life
Interview Questions: Do you know what I'm saying?

title: Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The questions began based on my present research. I explained to the interviewer as to on what my work experience has been thus far. The interviewer seemed quite satisfied with the explanation. I then went on to explain why I would like to work on this particular lab and what prompted me to apply. I was asked what I expected from the lab in return. I told my potential recruiter when I can likely join the lab. I was asked if I would be able to provide a letter of recommendation/ NO objection form. I nodded with a yes. The interview lasted for about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in doing a PhD?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I did my undergraduate degree at UGA, so I already knew the professor. I asked them about graduate school opportunities and they encouraged me to apply from the program. I did research with this professor, so they wrote me a recommendation letter as well. After that, I talked with the graduate admissions faculty and they helped me prepare the documents I needed to finish my application.
Interview Questions: I simply submitted the general application requirements.

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: There were a series of questions about previous work experience, career goals, etc. Overall, it was a by the book, straightforward, and friendly interview process. Marsha was a great interviewer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in ten years?

title: Building Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two very kind young ladies interviewed me... it went well. I enjoyed it VERY much. It was a pleasure working with them! I'd love to continue working with my alma mater!
Interview Questions: What would your former co-workers say about you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal. They told you what they expected of you in the role, gave you study material to learn how the library sorts books, and asked that you come back the next day to test over what you learned. As long as you passed the test then you're hired. They even give you two tries on the test in case you fail it the first time.
Interview Questions: Can you learn our sorting system today and come back tomorrow to be tested?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- Short, sweet and quick. 
- Overall positive, awesome interviewers!
- Easy application process
- Cover letter required
- Easy scheduled interview
- 1 round of interviews
- 2 interviewers 
- Follow up and contact process on behalf of supervisors was great
Interview Questions: - Behavioral Questions

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: A two interview process, mostly behavioural questions such as the typical, "tell us about yourself" and  "show us a time when you demonstrated leadership." A few situational questions about if something happens in the weight room and how you would act.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Applications Programmer Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first and latter on site interview with managers.  Many questions about past experience.  There were some technical questions but were not the core of the interview.
Interview Questions: What is a singleton and for what do you use it?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a call a few weeks later to come in the next day. I was super early (new to the area, not familiar with bus routes) and there was a kind of chaotic environment. The actual interviews (I met with several people) were short and not difficult. I brought a portfolio and it was less of a firing of questions and more a discussion of what the position would be. On leaving, I wasn't sure if it went well or terribly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It can take one or more years of applying to even get called in for an interview.  Once you get the call you will most likely be asked to come to the building in which you are applying, and you can expect to meet with at least 2/3 people in that first interview.  My experience was that you would be called back for a second interview.  Some people are asked to stay and perform Excel tests.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy, people asked exactly what I expected. There were really no tough questions. The interview itself was short. The people were nice at first but, they were not nice during the work experience.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted in two days of 1 to 1 and group meetings with the commission members and other involved faculties. I also had to deliver an hour-long seminar. The commission was very friendly and welcoming, and even if they were constantly testing my skills and attitude, I never felt uncomfortable. I felt a strong collegiality in the institution and this helped the interview process.
Interview Questions: How would I solve munication problems with my students

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: They called me on the phone and asked if I was still interested in the position. I was, and the interview was conducted two days later. I enjoyed the interview with the director of the department and her assistant, but unfortunately could not accept employment due to my visa status - the position did not require minimum of Bachelor degree education. Other than that it was a very pleasant interview.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I talked to 3 professors about the research conducted in their labs. Then I discussed my background/ bachelors degree experience working in an organic chemistry lab. I ultimately joined one of the labs for my PhD.
Interview Questions: What kind of lab experiments were conducted in your bachelors degree program?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, are you able to work at these times? Be honest and you will be fine. I applied online using the dawg House. Usually it takes a while for jobs to open because housing jobs are the most popular around campus. OA can't really do homework. Desk Assistant are better.
Interview Questions: are you able to work at these times?

title: Applications Analyst Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on the UGA HR website. I received a response in 10 days. The interview process was fairly straight forward. Had a single 2 hour interview with the team. There were a few behavioral interview questions but for the most part the questions were related to past work experience.
Interview Questions: What do you think are the two most important skills you gained from previous work experience?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: It was a committee interview, where I came into a conference room with 6 employees from the department (one was a student intern and two others were graduate assistants).  They all had questions prepared but only two were really interested in my work experience (meaning, they were looking at a copy of my resume -- nobody else seemed to have a copy).
Interview Questions: Describe the most difficult experience you had in your last position and tell us how you overcame it.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I talked to a person in the athletic office. As a former athlete, we are required to do an internship with the athletic association so when the job opened up I was place in the role  after talking it over with my boss. The process was not difficult.
Interview Questions: They did not ask me anything that was too terribly difficult.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview it was merit based. You randomly get which class you'll be TA. Minimum speaking score In GRE required is 26. But still whole profile is taken into consideration while giving TA to students
Interview Questions: Ate u interested in TA

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a phone interview then proceeded to an on campus interview. The process was very structured and very well organized. My experience was amazing and everyone was very helpful. Everyone I spoke to seemed very positive and welcoming with the exception of one person. It seemed there was some internal conflict around the type of candidates being considered. Despite this, I think I was given a fair chance to show that I was a good fit. The entire process took about a month once I was contacted and about 2 months from when I applied.
Interview Questions: What difficulties do you foresee as the director and how will you navigate them in order to attain the goals outlined by the department or your office?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Volunteered as undergraduate researcher for nothing, then for class credit, then eventually offered job without interview. I got lucky because I did good work, and they were looking for a replacement. I was emailed asking if I wanted a job, and I said yes.
Interview Questions: what is your desired salary

title: Public Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted to schedule a Skype interview. The panel I interviewed with via Skype consisted of my prospective boss, members of the department, other PR coordinators, and the vice president in the relevant area. After the Skype interview, I was contacted to schedule an in-person interview. I was coming from quite a distance, so UGA took care of my hotel accommodations and reimbursed me for my travel and meals. I had done several interviews with competitors (UT, Clemson, etc.) who had not done that, so that meant a lot to me. I had a full day of interviews and toured the facilities of the department. I interviewed with the director, the associate directors, the student team, and the search committee. I also had to give a presentation to the entire department. It was an exhausting day, but really allowed me to see what the position would be like. I got an offer and accepted it.
Interview Questions: What are some of your marketing pet peeves?

title: Ticket Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy, asking about experience in sales, telling you about the job, and then putting you in situations where you are dealing with non-UGA fans and have to quickly answer with a strategy about how to provide a solution and sell them tickets.  The questions are really easy to answer and are mostly asked to see how quickly you respond under pressure.  If you have enough experience, you should get the position.
Interview Questions: What if you call someone who is a Florida fan, how would you try to sell them UGA tickets?

title: Outdoor Recreation Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with student manager. Friendly and laid-back, but important to not act as if you are not in an interview. After receiving offer, I was told that professional dress during the interview was a significant factor in my hiring over other applicants.
Interview Questions: Imagine you have a problem with a co-worker; how would you go about resolving this issue?

title: IT Professional Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long but insightful. The entire department came to my interview presentation. Members form the department are usually given a check off sheet from the interviewing manager during your presentation to make sure you hit all the high points. You get to go out to eat after the interview one on one with the interviewing manager. The interview is long but not hard at all.
Interview Questions: Are there any aspects of this job that you feel that you will not be able to handle?

title: Facility Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: You will Meet with a GRaduate assistant or supervisor in a conference room. You will be presented Standard interview questions. The Location of the interview will most likely be Ramsey.
Interview Questions: Name 3 strengths.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, in person interview. Basically just asked why I wanted the job and how I would go about performing it.The goal was to make sure I was actually interested in the position and passionate about the speciality and students. Sat in a room with two interviewers and answered their very basic questions for about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: How will you deal with students who don't respond to your messages?

title: 4-H Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Extensive background checks and physical activity, the interview process is a question section as well as tests to see your level of enthusiasm and stamina. It is a fun but stressful interview
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself in one word?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: those are really nice people who wont make you feel nerves.   I have the whole lab interviewed me, each one of them asked a question. after that, they asked me see if i have any question for the lab. then a lab tour followed by the interview.
Interview Questions: how you solve conflict at work?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two separate interviews: One with the team of advisors (group interview) and another with the director (1-on-1). I was offered the position within one week of the interview. The questions were experiential in nature and focused on my ability to do the tasks listed in the job description.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working with students

title: Director of Grants and Contracts Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Columbia, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview went well. Next step was a Skype interview. Skype interview with search committee was atrocious. Felt like I was wasting their time. One person actually dozed off. Pitiful and a waste of my time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UGA?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1 round behavioral with the Residence Hall Director and it only took 1 day. Basic questions that could be answered on the spot by applicants.  Got back to me really quickly and laid out hours upfront.
Interview Questions: why a DA?

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job in June but didn't get an interview until October.  They didn't let me know I got the job until November.  I attempted to negotiate salary as I felt I should have been paid more than the intro rate as I have an advanced degree, but was told there would be no negotiation as it would create "salary inequity" among the others in the same position.  This is a disadvantage of working for the government, as everyone's salary is public knowledge.
Interview Questions: I was asked to explain what my biggest failure was at my current job (at the time).

title: Public Relations and Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
There were two parts to the interview 
Part one: Asked us general questions about our involvement on campus and how those skills learned through those experiences could be transferred in the office setting 
Part two: Went into more detail about job experience, campus involvement as well as scenarios that could potentially take place in the office to note our impromptu responses
Interview Questions: If an African-American parent came to you and asked why should my child attend a Predominantly White Institution (PWI) versus a Historically Black College and University (HBCU), what would you say to them?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied in November 2014, and and learned about the on-site interview in around christmas 2014. I was asked to choose dates for visiting. I selected mid-jury. It was extremely exhaustive. For continuously two days I had to meet people and talks in between.
Interview Questions: There was one research talk and one chalk talk.

title: Student Assistant - Maps and Government Library Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied through DAWG link and they notified me by phone to schedule an interview. Most questions were pretty basic. The person interviewing you went down a list of very general questions. Mostly asked about your schedule, what previous work experience you held, how you work with/without supervision, what major are you and why. They talked about what they expect of you at work, just general guidelines you have to follow. Very simple.
Interview Questions: None, very typical interview questions.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I only had a phone call, where my prospective boss basically used the time to sell me the job rather than have me answer too many questions, so it was rather unconventional. I was applying from a different country so I'm sure that if I were there I would have had to attend an interview in person.
Interview Questions: It was the easiest interview I ever had

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I conducted a skype interview with lab PI. I was asked several questions about my project management experience and given a brief overview of the work being completed in the lab.
Interview Questions: They asked questions about my experience relating to the laboratory's projects.

title: Research Professional III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: Took about two months from submission of resume to call for interview. Had the interview and was offered the position within 24 hours. Interview was a panel interview with eight other members of the staff, and covered every possible angle of the position.
Interview Questions: Theoretical question on how to handle a research project within the college that was not actually part of the job description.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: About 3 hours long of both oral and written interviews. There are usually a lot of people who you will compete for a position. Make the most of it. Be yourself and be confident.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: HR does not communicate well and the whole process can be pretty opaque and drag on for a while. Large panel of interviewers. Sometimes a second interview is possible. Be calm and familiarize yourself as much as possible with the UGA courses and programs and services so that you will have some concrete things to draw on and prove that you are somewhat familiar with the campus and the culture of the place.
Interview Questions: Discuss a challenging workplace situation or conflict and how you handled it. Three words previous employers and colleagues would use to describe you.

title: EITS Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was in front of three people and I was asked very generic interview questions like, "What would you do if a customer was being difficult?" Overall interview was really easy and I got a response back pretty quickly. There interview was the only part of the job hiring process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had a difficult time with a customer.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I was a current temp worker, former student worker, so the interview was very informal and more of a legal technicality than a real interview.
Interview Questions: How long do you expect to be here?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were all day long and the questions were very general. Not really sure how they picked the best candidates. The multitude of people made the interviews very intimidating.
Interview Questions: What are your ideas for bridging the gaps between students on halls that do not get along?

title: Bus Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online then the Transit Training Director will contact you shortly asking some basic questions concerning the minimum requirements to become a bus operator. If you qualify and they have open positions they will contact you to set-up an interview time. The interview is more or less a formality and just makes sure there are no hidden problems with you or your driving record. If you get an interview, you can basically consider that a job offer assuming your interview does not reveal something previously unknown.
Interview Questions: Have you ever operated a bus or large vehicle before?

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Got called by the front desk manager (Simone) and asked to come in. I waited for her by the desk for about 15 minutes and then we went in and sat down in the side lobby area (hill atrium) and talked for about forty-five minutes or so. Very relaxed, Simone is extremely nice.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had trouble with a customer and how did you resolve it?

title: Manufacturing Engineer Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Augusta, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Came to the university and spoke with me. Asked questions like: what have i done, am i comfortable with certain jobs, what do i enjoy doing, what do i want to get out of this if offered.
Interview Questions: driving down a road, no cell phone, no technology and your tire falls off and you lose all the lug nuts. what do you do?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process  involved giving a long set of  credentials.Tell the candidate a little about the job: While you don't want to dominate the interview time, you should start with a brief summary of the position, including the prime responsibilities, reporting structure, key challenges, and performance criteria. This will help the candidate provide relevant examples and responses. on't be afraid to improvise: Plan your questions, but don't feel you must ask only those you've chosen in advance. "Be responsive to what the candidate tells you, and build new questions off their answers," says Shelly Goldman, executive recruiter with The Goldman Group Advantage, an executive recruiting firm in Reston, Virginia.
Interview Questions: Have you ever taught before?

title: Research Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked by a professor who I had previously known if I would like to help grade assignments and papers in his class. It was a job that demanded about 7 hours per week and I was able to mostly work from home.
Interview Questions: Would you like to work with me?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: talk with the professor, do some research show your own capacity
Interview Questions: they should have fund

title: Student Culinary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: For a student worker, none. You submit your schedule and a short online form, and they get back to you in a few months with a position. For a student culinary, you must have already been working at a dining hall for a few months to get experience. You fill out a short form. There is no interview, but you may be denied the position because of inexperience/no openings in the shop you want.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: 8 a.m. - 3 p.m. (all day) interview with presentation.  First I met with "Admin team" then employer relations team, then career consultants.  After that I presented a presentation on a career related topic to everyone in the basement conference room. During the interview, you are to act as if you are a Career Consultant already and presenting to a group of students.
Interview Questions: What is your experience related to Career Services?

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with three supervisors - applied through UGA HR website. Process can take very long and verification through I-9, background checks, etc is very cumbersome. In person interview, then called and offered position one week later. It is much easier for hiring if you are already in the UGA system.
Interview Questions: What have you learned from being a supervisor to workers older than you?

title: Network Operations Call Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. Most of the questions were behavioral and pretty straight forward. They were just trying to get to know me as a person to see if I would work well in the office. They did have a few technical questions that I personally did not know the answer to at the time but that did not affect me in getting the offer. They were looking more at what type of person I was than what I knew about networking
