Interview Questions: What is a MAC address?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with a group of six senior level advisors in a small group setting.  They had initial questions that were scripted that they ask of all applicants.  There was then a general question and answer portion.  Finally, I had the opportunity to ask the panel questions about working at UGA; they al expressed their positive experiences.
Interview Questions: If you are meeting with a student who does not have the required GPA to get into Grady/Terry College, what would you do?

title: Research Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended by someone internally, so the interview process was less formal. Submitted online application. Met with my direct supervisor, then with potential coworkers, then with supervisor's boss. Received offer letter.
Interview Questions: Describe background experience as it relates to role; standard questions

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Submit paper application and then interview. 
Process took about three days. 
Wanted to see what kind of person I was. 
Face to face
Very comfortable, as if I was speaking to a relative. 
Was asked several questions regarding how I would respond if a certain scenario came up
Talked about policies and scheduling
Let you know if hired on the spot
Interview Questions: What skills do I possess that can help residents live comfortably and ask questions comfortably?

title: Peabody Cataloging Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over the phone with the supervisor of the department. It was short and simple. I had to be persistent with emailing the supervisor of the department in order to get the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Main Library Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy, they basically just want to know that you are going to show up for your shifts on time and do all the rounds associated with the job. Turnover is really high but they also get lots of applicants.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work weekends?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a professor for a research assistantship position.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions. I was asked about my study, research and experiences.

title: Environmental Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with director of 4-H Center to discuss the position. The conversation focused on specific experiences relatable to environmental education (i.e., science courses, outdoor activities, etc.). The conversation was more informal than formal. To prep, creating a list of educational experiences recommended. The majority of communication occurred via email prior to interview with the director. Questions about experiences listed on resume were the focus of the interview.
Interview Questions: What experiences would make you an ideal candidate for this position?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Students are eligible to hold a position as a RA after completion of their first year.  The application process is two-fold.  Applicants must first write an essay explaining why they would like to work for the Department of University Housing in response to an essay prompt and also fill out an online application which includes references.   If selected, applicants will then take part in a panel interview.
Interview Questions: What would you contribute as a RA?

title: Data Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the program manager, who interviewed me alongside the office manager and a staff member performing a similar duty. I was asked questions for about 15 minutes, ranging from softball personal questions to my experience cold calling in previous jobs. I was also asked why I left my previous employer, and where I saw myself in a year and where I saw myself in five years.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in the future?
Are you comfortable talking on the phone?
Do you know what our research focuses on?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very similar to postdoc position interview from other universities:  sit-down Q&A with PI and perhaps other lab members, along with a 30-60 minute research presentation.  The presentation will open you up to questions on your data (so be prepared!).
Interview Questions: What do you think about the project?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview by committee made up of the hiring manager and some of the other team members. The interview was casual and fairly easy going, with a mixture of technical questions and "soft skills" questions.
Interview Questions: What is an emerging technology that you are excited about or interested in?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. I applied and received the job. This is a great University, I love Athens. The professors are very qualified and prepared to train any technicians or scientist.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous experience in a lab setting.

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied the night before and interviewed the very next day.  The person who interviewed me was a professor in the communications department, and she has got to be one of the coolest professors to have as your supervisor.  The interview was very laid back, and mainly just making sure you could do the job after being trained.
Interview Questions: Do you believe you will be able to focus on this computer screen and notice every single thing that person does and code it into this program without messing everyone else up?

title: Cook II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
It was a round table to interview, I had never had that experience before and to me it was a very laid back interview.  I had the opportunity to meet all of the managers, and see the dinning hall, where I would be working. 
I was offered a job, but it wasn't the job I interviewed for, I ended up moving from the front to the kitchen with in 2 months of working for UGA.
Interview Questions: What was the largest event you cooked for?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty simple interview. I met with the department head, the hiring manager, and the woman who I'd be working for. I had to meet at the Department main office in Athens, GA, even though my job was in Atlanta.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with Microsoft Office

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with two people from senior management, went to a conference room, and was asked a series of questions about finance, accounting, teaching, instruction, and customer service. Was given a number of hypothetical questions I had to respond to. After the interview, they contacted my former employer and asked about my previous performance for 30 minutes, called back in for a second interview with 4 people from senior management.
Interview Questions: How capable are you to explain essential accounting concepts to people with no business background?

title: Box Office Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by an employee, and interviewed a week later. Questions were based mostly on my resume, as well as a few STAR based questions. Wasn't particularly difficult, though it was a panel of interviewers rather than just a single person. Everyone seemed nice enough, I wasn't grilled too hard.
Interview Questions: Can you provide your own transportation to shows on nights and weekends?

title: Laboratory Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was laid back but intimidating because there were four people interviewing me. Since I was already an employee just being promoted I knew everyone. They asked me question about my education, my plans for the future and made sure that I qualified for the job that I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Do you plan to be here until you retire?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
synthesis work, chemical biology study towards vaccine development.
complex carbohydrate research,
Interview Questions: research experience is important

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process were perfect.  They didn't make me jump through many hurdles, and it overall was a great experience in interviewing all the same.  One of my professors reached out to the hiring office with a recommendation for me, and the hiring office was quite quick and responsive to my emails with inquiries.  The hiring managers had a great attention to student service!
Interview Questions: There weren't any.  It was really a straight-forward interview process.  They had my resume and asked questions based off of information on my resume.  It was overall a quick process, and I was very grateful for the job!

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: One-on-One interview with hiring manager. Very laid back interview. They will ask you various questions based on CV. They will ask you to pipette a few solutions.You get a chance to talk to the PhD students also
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Student Manager for UGA Football Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Sit-down interview where they really just wanted to get to know me. Asked a lot about my background as it related to football. Wanted to know what my major and gap was because the job is very intense, and it could be tough balancing school and work.
Interview Questions: How would your friends describe you?

title: Event Services Student Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview. Asked questions about why you wanted to work as a student employee, availability, past work experience, etc. They want to make sure that you will be able to work around your class schedule and not be too burdened by working a part time job.
Interview Questions: Can you lift objects up to 25 pounds?

title: Vehicle Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Fairly short. Asked a couple of personality questions to get to know you better. If you get to the interview, you're basically locked for the job. It was a 1 on 1 interview with the head of the training department. He went over the training and how things operated there.
Interview Questions: Do you like driving?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with PIs. They asked relevant questions and were very polite and had read my CV. Was very open discussion and invited questions. One of best positions even though was a lot of work, they let me work as I saw fit and provided assistance when needed. Even went out of their way to get me my new permanent job which is AWESOME when contract ended.
Interview Questions: What steps would I take to get the project up and running ASAP keeping in mind the study integrity and budget.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process deals mostly with previous undergraduate education, work ethic, and prior employment that related to my graduate assistantship. Be prepared to speak about your topic of study. If you are a prospective grad student you should be prepared to talk about and recent relevant studies in your area of concentration. Especially if you are repeating a previous study or experiment.
Interview Questions: My interview was very specific to my research- they asked me detailed questions about my particular field of research.

title: Student Worker - Video Editor/Multimedia Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Encountered Geof Gilland (current supervisor) during film project. Inquired about opportunities in video and media at the university. Informed of open student worker position. Ask to describe the processes and handling of Final Cut Pro 7, Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe After Effects, Sony HDV XDCAM camera, video equipment set up and break down.
Interview Questions: Describing the different uses of XDCAM discs compared with memory cards and DV tapes, describing different uses and reasons for video equipment (tripods, lenses, cleaning, etc.)

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Work Study - The State Botanical Garden of Georgia Applied online after being approved for a federal work study grant. They asked a few basic questions about my high school involvement, college and career goals and gardening/environmental interests. They got back to me within several days and have been wonderful ever since.
Interview Questions: No really difficult questions.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process depend on the lab you are applying to.
In general, you will have to give a group presentation and then have a 1:1 meeting with the investigator.
You may be interviewed by other PIs.
Be prepared to answer questions about your research after  you give your talk, and about your research interests and expertise
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Handyman Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The HR person I met with was very nice and knowledgeable. She explained the job and what was expected. She then outlined the interview process and when I could expect to hear back from them. Overall it was quick and very straightforward.
Interview Questions: They inquired about my years of experience.

title: Climbing Wall Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I talked to a climbing partner of mine who worked at the wall, he recommended I apply. I went in for a short but thorough interview a few days after submitting my application. In general, the interview was to judge cultural fit, and to assess hard and fast skills in first-aid, climbing safety, and overall knowledge of the sport.
Interview Questions: Safety is important here at the wall. How would you work to strengthen this value.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted over the phone. i was essentially just called and offered the job. I was called before 5, and was asked to be at work the next morning at 7:30 along with my completed paperwork. The paperwork took a long time and they ended up giving me an additional 2 hours pay for completing it. It was a pretty easy process.
Interview Questions: Do you still want a job?

title: Building Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Process is simple.
you will be called and told what your base pay will be (no negotiation).
you will sit down with a ton of questions that really add nothing to the position.
Interview Questions: a monkey can answer these questions as long as your half-prepared.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the application online and went in for an interview, but didn't get the position. Two years later I filled out the application online again and was called in for an interview 3 months later. I met with my immediate supervisor and we had a very casual conversation.
Interview Questions: The questions were difficult. She asked about my work ethic, organizational skills, and then we talked about things unrelated to the job.

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: very easy,  it is just hard  to get an opening
Interview Questions: none, it is going to come down to the hours available

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Online application. I knew 2 people who worked for that particular residence hall so that helped a lot. It is actually very hard to get the job unless you know someone. If you don't know someone, I would recommend going and introducing yourself in person after your submitting application.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult. They didn't even conduct a real interview. Basically just asked about my hours, flexibility, etc.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Must know the lab director in order to secure a position in the lab. Interview is brief and very informal. 99% of students coming in for an interview have already gotten the job.
Interview Questions: Are you serious about archaeology? Do you want to be an archaeologist? If no to either of questions, it's unlikely someone will be hired to work at the lab.

title: Lab Helper Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Griffin, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Offered job. Accepted job.
Interview Questions: Will you accept this job?

title: Web Developer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
(1) Apply for the job posted at the UGA website (iPAWS)
(2) If selected for interview, the hiring manager will contact you
(3) If selected to be hired, the director/manager will contact you and present the job offer letter
(4) If you accept the offer, the HR process will kick in (background check, Visa process for international employees, etc.)
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: 4-5 person panel.  Ask you selected canned questions.  Strenght, weakness....
Interview Questions: Strengths.

title: Building Service Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at University of Georgia in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: go in for an interview that took like a year from the date that i filled out the application then takes 2 weeks to call you back after that for you to sign for the background check then another 2 weeks for them to do the background check. then after you are hired you have to wait a whoile month to get paid.
Interview Questions: how will you make our company better??

title: Applications Programmer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions:
First my boss interviewed me, he was checking if I am not looking at this position as a long time or not, when he was satisfied he allowed his programmers to interview me . 
Then everybody told me about their experience of working there. 
Finally I was offered job and its seemed short and nice interview .
Interview Questions: What are your plans for future ?

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: I emailed professor directly. I visited the lab, but did not formally interview or give a presentation.
Interview Questions: I visited the lab in question but was not really asked a single question. I asked plenty, but the professor had absolutely no questions for me.

title: Sports Turf Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: I just received a phone call and he basically told me I had the job. It wasn't an actual interview really. I just applied and I got it. That is probably why they don't always have top quality employees. I got the job through a class I took at the university. There is literally no room for negotiation. I got minimum wage for almost 3 full years. They asked me if I was ok with certain job duties, I said yes, they said you have the job and took me to fill out the paper work.
Interview Questions: Can you use a weedeater?

title: Human Resource Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: First a phone interview with a few questions was administered and then I came in for a one on one immediately followed by a group interview.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength and weakness?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Georgia (Athens, GA) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: The initial contact was via phone. The Conference & Event Planning Department Head(who is now my boss) called to discuss the position with me and to ask some questions about my qualificiations. After the initial phone interview, I was invited in for an in-person panel interview.  I was intereviewed by 8 people over a one-hour period. The next interview was a one-on-one interview with the Director of the Georgia Center.  After all this, an offer was extended within one week.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you over the other applicants?
